snippet: Five years after remarks by Bill Clinton about Barack Obama strained the Clintons’ bond with African-Americans, the former first family is setting out to ensure that there is no replay of such trouble in 2016.
abstract: Hillary and Bill Clinton are seeking to soothe and strengthen their relationship with the African-American community; Bill Clinton's remarks about Barack Obama during 2008 presidential contest deeply strained the Clintons' bond with African-Americans, and the former first family is setting out to ensure that there is no replay of such trouble in 2016.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and JONATHAN MARTIN

lead_paragraph: Five years after remarks by Bill Clinton about Barack Obama strained the Clintons’ bond with African-Americans, the former first family is setting out to ensure that there is no replay of such trouble in 2016.

headline.main: Eye on 2016, Clintons Rebuild Bond With Blacks
headline.print_headline: Eye on ’16, Clintons Rebuild Bond With Blacks
